intro: Glossopetalon nevadense f. glabrum, commonly known as the smoothleaf glossopetalon, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the high elevations of the Sierra Nevada in California. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh alpine environment.
